top_comment.text:
At around 7:19 into the video, the writing inside the box says "Светуня". 
That's hilarious. That's a Russian girl's name, derivative of Svetlana, 
coincidentally, my wife's name.

On the unrelated note. As everyone else here, I think that Onetox Ramukanji 
song is awesome. Kudos for using it in your videos. I hope these guys make 
something out of their sudden fame. Great videos, too, for us, office rats 
:)﻿
top_comment.author: krotizmultika

comments.author: Toosin Beymen

comments.text:
That's a tough one.  First off we follow reports from noonsite.com, and 
local officials and try to not visit these places in general.  We've had 
locals canoe out to us and warn us not to stay the night- we were sure to 
get robbed.  We thanks them and sailed away before the sunset. In a known 
area where there's been trouble we do night watches just like we were 
sailing, except we're at anchor with big machetes, air horns, and massive 
spot lights.  We have been boarded twice (once in Indonesia, and once in 
the Solomon Islands) but both times we could scare them off before they 
stole too much.  The creeps always come out at night!  You might find these 
blogs entertaining :)
http://svdelos.blogspot.com/2013/09/pirate-watch-in-sorong-by-brian.htmlhttp://svdelos.blogspot.com/2011/10/pirate-watch-quiz-by-paul.htmlCheers 
and thanks for watching!BrianS\V Delos
comments.author: SV Delos Crew

comments.text:
Thanks for watching man!  So we're using all Creative Commons available 
music, or things from friends\family now which is pretty sweet.  We think 
using non-mainstream music is the way to go.  If you or your friends have 
any tracks you think may be good for our videos send our way!The track your 
after is:Est Ce Que A Vou Plait - Mr Juanhttp://
www.jamendo.com/en/track/980594/est-ce-que-a-vous-plait-http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/
comments.author: SV Delos Crew

captions.text:
I had arrived back into Cairns
a few weeks eariler

After having being away from
Delos for over a year and a half

We spent a pretty sweet couple
of weeks getting back into the
rhythm of things

We took Delos out to Fitzroy
island, did some diving

out at the Great Barrier Reef,
explored the Mossman Rainforest

Drank lot's of wine, and got
our first sponsored item
Our new tender.. Maggie

Last but not least, we stuffed
Delos with as much food as we
could fit

And we felt pretty ready to
start the 1300 mile journey to
Darwin

So we checked the oil, took a
last glance of the skyline of
the city, and picked up the
anchor

It was pretty weird to be
sailing on Delos again..

I was having flashbacks of us
arriving into this very same
channel

only 18 months ago from The
Solomons. Such different people

A lot had happened and a lot
had changed,

but it was a really good
feeling! Nothing really
mattered but that very moment
and the journey ahead.

So our first stop was to be
Lizard Island.
Only 140 miles North.

"It's exactly why down-wind
sailing is so awesome!"
"fishing line project going on"

"Karin's doing some awesome
splicing"
"Sh *t everywhere!"

"And we're washing our car up
at the bow!"
"it's the middle of the night.."
"sail ripped.."
"JESUS"
"F * * *ing sucks man. No good"

But we made it to Lizard island
by first light

And definitely in high spirits.
It was the 4th of July!

Of course, we started off early
with some Gin and Tonic's

And decided it was perfect
occasion to dress up!

"It's America Day! We are at
the Lizard Islands

"LEZERD!"
"LEZERD ISLANDS!"

"It's like 140 miles and we did
it in ahhh 15 hours!"

"But it went good, except we broke my favourite sail last night"
"Uh oh"
"Forward mizzen balloona"

"It's sucks.. but hey!"
"Always something eh?"

"Oh, we're sizzling up some bacon!"
"Ohhh, who have we got here?!"

After some bacon and egg's for
breakfast

We spent the rest of the
afternoon doing what we do
best. Not much.

Although feeling a little hazy,
the next day we put on our
walking shoes for a detoxing
hike

to the top of the island. Cooks
Look track.

Caption James Cook had climbed
to the top back in 1770.

Caption James Cook had climbed
to the top back in 1770.

To look for a pass out of The
Great Barrier Reef.

So it was actually quite cool
walking in his footsteps so
many years later!
Some parts were pretty tough,

and the heat was really
intense, not really the best
combinations

for some of us who were feeling
pretty hungover...

"Almost to the top!"
"Mm hm..."
"Pooks Look!"
"F * * * it's hot!"

But we pushed through and we
made it!

And had the most stunning 360
degree view!
We found a box at the top

with a can of 4X Gold.
"Full can of beer!"
Some history about the track
and a visitor's book

which we leafed through, and
found some fellow friends, who
had cruised through only a few
weeks earlier.

Hopefully we would catch up
with them in Darwin.
"Happy Birthday Tiffaaaaaay!"

We'd been stuck at anchor for
about a week at this stage.
Constant strong winds up to 50
knots.
At least Delos was holding well

"What are you doing Braidster?"
"Making Moonshine"
"Making homemade liquor"
Despite making alcohol,

cabin fever, and boredom got
the better of us, we came up
with a stupid but brilliant idea
That lasted about 2 months.
"Don't look!"

"The first Prince of the week
is...

"Wohooo!"
(clapping)

Stay tuned, as we pick up the
anchor, unfill the jib,

and continue the journey north.
Onto secluded bays,

exploring secret trails. More
silly adventures..
And much more sailing!
